alert.note: Alert for Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 12 at 7:15AM CDT until March 23 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 AM CDT FOR SOUTHERN TENSAS AND NORTHEASTERN CONCORDIA PARISHES...SOUTHERN CLAIBORNE...WESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTHEASTERN ADAMS COUNTIES... At 715 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Port Gibson to 6 miles south of St. Joseph to Clayton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Alcorn and Port Gibson around 720 AM CDT. Waterproof around 725 AM CDT. Hermanville, Lorman and Pattison around 730 AM CDT. Fayette around 735 AM CDT. Red Lick and Church Hill around 740 AM CDT. Stanton around 745 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Ridgecrest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
